Title: A cladistic analysis of Dipsacaceae (Dipsacales).
Abstract:
A cladistic study of Dipsacaceae (Asteridae, Dipsacales)
was undertaken, based mainly on morphological and palynological
characters, obtained by investigations of herbarium material and from
the literature. Outgroups included Morinaceae, Triplostegiaceae, and a
subset of Valerianaceae. The consensus tree resulting from three equally
parsimonious cladograms shows that Dipsacaceae are divided into two
major clades, one with Dipsacus and Cephalaria, the other including the
remaining genera. Within the latter clade, Knautia is the sister group
of the rest of the taxa. This study is a reappraisal of Dipsacaceae
phylogeny, and the results broadly match previous evidence.
